categoryDescriptions.fun: Fun commands: they have no real purpose other than to entertain. Enjoy :)
categoryDescriptions.moderation: These commands are specifically for disciplining members or providing corrective action.
categoryDescriptions.macro: Macro commands are useful for maintaining and displaying helpful messages.
categoryDescriptions.utility: Generally useful commands. This is a misc section.
categoryDescriptions.infractions: Used for distributing and maintaining strike-based infractions.
categoryDescriptions.permissions: Administrative functionality for setting command permissions.
categoryDescriptions.suggestions: You can use commands in this section to give suggestions to the server.
categoryDescriptions.embed: Commands used to build an embed and then send it. You build an embed by using the set/add commands (listed below) - when ready, use sendembed
categoryDescriptions.banqueue: Commands used for preventing raids and setting up bans. Each moderator has a raid queue in which they can 'pre-load' some bans, with a defined reason.
categoryDescriptions.profiles: Commands relating to the profile queue for posting developer profiles or introductions
categoryDescriptions.security: Commands for modifying security features and thresholds of the bot.
categoryDescriptions.invites: Commands for dictating how the bot will handle invites
categoryDescriptions.rank: Commands for granting and removing ranks.
categoryDescriptions.poll: Commands related to polling questions and answers

commands.name: cat
commands.description: Displays a picture of a cat.

commands.name: flip
commands.description: Flips a coin.

commands.name: dog
commands.description: Display a picture of a dog

commands.name: bird
commands.description: Display a picture of a bird

commands.name: addmacro
commands.description: Adds a macro which will respond with the given message when invoked by the given name.

commands.name: removemacro
commands.description: Removes a macro with the given name

commands.name: listmacros
commands.description: List all of the currently available macros.

commands.name: nuke
commands.description: Delete the last 1 - 99 messages in the chat.

commands.name: move
commands.description: Move every message sent by any of the users with the IDs listed found within the given search space to the specified channel.
commands.structure: {idList (a list of user ids, separated by commas)} {searchSpace} {targetChannelID}

commands.name: ignore
commands.description: Drop all commands from the given id (user or channel)

commands.name: mute
commands.description: Mute a member for a specified number of minutes.

commands.name: lockdown
commands.description: Force the bot to ignore anyone who isn't the owner.

commands.name: prefix
commands.description: Set the bot prefix to the specified string (Cannot be a space)

commands.name: setFilter
commands.description: Set the permission level required to run a command which contains a mention (used for mention sanitation)

commands.name: setPermission
commands.description: Set the permission level of the given command to the given permission level.

commands.name: getPermission
commands.description: Get the current required permission level for a particular command.

commands.name: listCommandPerms
commands.description: Display all current commands and the corresponding required permission level to use each of them.

commands.name: roleids
commands.description: Display each role in the server with its corresponding ID

commands.name: warn
commands.description: Warn a member, giving them a 0 strike infraction with the given reason.

commands.name: strike
commands.description: Give a member a weighted infraction, with specified weight and reason. This may result in them being banned. Weights should be below or equal to StrikeCeil
commands.example: 1324234523048 1 Refusing to stop arguing. Please pay more attention to what moderators are saying to you

commands.name: history
commands.description: Display a user's infraction history.

commands.name: removeStrike
commands.description: Delete a particular strike by ID (these are listed in the history command).

commands.name: cleanse
commands.description: Completely wipe a user of all infractions. (Permanently deletes them)

commands.name: selfhistory
commands.description: See your own infraction history.

commands.name: note
commands.description: Add a note to a user's history

commands.name: removeNote
commands.description: Removes a note by ID (listed in history)

commands.name: cleanseNotes
commands.description: Wipes all notes from a user (permanently deleted).

commands.name: ping
commands.description: Pong!

commands.name: version
commands.description: Display the bot version -- this is updated via maven filtering.

commands.name: author
commands.description: Display project authors -- this is updated via maven filtering.

commands.name: help
commands.description: Display a help menu.

commands.name: serverinfo
commands.description: Display a message giving basic server information

commands.name: exit
commands.description: Exit, saving configurations.

commands.name: kill
commands.description: Exit, without saving configurations.

commands.name: uptime
commands.description: Displays how long you have kept me, HOTBOT, AWAKE!

commands.name: suggest
commands.description: Send a suggestion to the pre-lim pool. Suggestions are reviewed by a mod before they are reviewed by the community.
commands.example: I want a rust channel because I want a rust channel. **Notice me senpai**

commands.name: poolinfo
commands.description: Display how many suggestions are in the staging area.

commands.name: poolTop
commands.description: See the suggestion in the pool next in line for review.

commands.name: poolaccept
commands.description: Move the suggestion at the top of the pool to the community review stage.

commands.name: pooldeny
commands.description: Delete the suggestion at the top of the pool; this is for removing bad or vulgar suggestions.

commands.name: respond
commands.description: Respond to a suggestion in the community review stage. Suggestions here can be accepted or denied, must supply a reason.
commands.example: 1231928401824 Denied This is a bad suggestion, it won't really fit here, sadly.

commands.name: badname
commands.description: Auto-nick a user with a bad name.

commands.name: clearEmbed
commands.description: Reset the embed in memory

commands.name: sendEmbed
commands.description: Send the embed in the channel. This will not call clearEmbed.

commands.name: copyembed
commands.description: Copies the embed from the message with the given id into the embed builder. The channelId from which to get the embed is optional and will default to the one you invoked the command in.

commands.name: editfield
commands.description: Edits a field in the current embed being worked on. The passed index should be from 0 to fields.size - 1. Properties: name, text (or value), inline.

commands.name: setTitle
commands.description: Set the title of the embed in memory

commands.name: setDescription
commands.description: Set the description of the embed

commands.name: addTimestamp
commands.description: Add a timestamp to the footer of the embed in memory

commands.name: setColour
commands.description: Set the colour of the embed using RGB -- values must be between 0 and 1

commands.name: setSelfAuthor
commands.description: Set yourself to be the author of the embed

commands.name: setAuthor
commands.description: Set a user with the given ID to be the author

commands.name: setImage
commands.description: Set the image of the embed

commands.name: setFooter
commands.description: Set the footer of the embed, including the URL and text

commands.name: addBlankField
commands.description: Add a blank field to the embed

commands.name: addField
commands.description: Add the field currently held in memory to the embed currently held in memory (Note: Use setFName and setFText to set the text)

commands.name: addIField
commands.description: Inline and add the field currently held in memory to the embed currently held in memory (Note: Use setFName and setFText to set the text)

commands.name: clearFieldHolder
commands.description: Clear the fields out in the field in memory, resetting the field to a new one

commands.name: setFText
commands.description: Set the field text in memory
commands.example: this text will be appended to the bottom of the field... :)

commands.name: setFName
commands.description: Set the field name or title
commands.example: This text will be set as the title of the field... :)

commands.name: setThumbnail
commands.description: Set the thumbnail of the embed

commands.name: echo
commands.description: Echo a message to a channel

commands.name: submitprofile
commands.description: Submit a profile to the profile queue, it'll be reviewed by a moderator. YES, you need to match the format! Read the FAQ for formatting!
commands.example:
**Who are you?** 
  hotbot! 
 **What is your experience?** 
 everything! 
 **What languages are you really, really comfortable with?** 
 Kotlin! 
 **What other languages have you used/do you know of?** 
 Java! 
 **Anything else you'd like to say?** 
 I like cake!

commands.name: acceptprofile
commands.description: Accept a profile and post it to the profiles channel.

commands.name: declineprofile
commands.description: Decline a profile, removing it from the queue.

commands.name: viewprofile
commands.description: View the profile at the top of the queue, allowing you to decide whether it should be accepted or rejected.

commands.name: joindate
commands.description: See when a member joined the guild.

commands.name: clearFields
commands.description: Clear the fields in the embed.

commands.name: unwhitelistinvite
commands.description: Remove an invitation from the whitelist.

commands.name: resetsecuritylevel
commands.description: Set the security level back to normal.

commands.name: makeroleungrantable
commands.description: Disallow granting of this role

commands.name: saveconfigurations
commands.description: Save the configuration of the bot. You may want to do this if you change the prefix.

commands.name: whitelistinvite
commands.description: Allow an invite to be posted.

commands.name: makerolegrantable
commands.description: Allow a role to be granted.

commands.name: viewnewplayers
commands.description: View what the bot deems as new players

commands.name: restart
commands.description: Restart the bot.

commands.name: setsecuritylevel
commands.description: Set the bot's security level

commands.name: revoke
commands.description: Revoke a rank from a user

commands.name: grant
commands.description: Grant a rank to a user.

commands.name: listgrantableroles
commands.description: List grantable roles

commands.name: securitylevel
commands.description: See what the current server security level is.

commands.name: viewCreationDate
commands.description: See when a user was created

commands.name: banRaider
commands.description: Ban a raider by an ID, do this rather than ban people as it'll exit them from the raidView

commands.name: freeRaider
commands.description: Free a raider by an ID, unmuting them. Do this rather than ban people as it'll exit them from the raidView as well.

commands.name: viewRaiders
commands.description: See what raiders are in the raidView

commands.name: freeAllRaiders
commands.description: For freeing all raiders from the raid queue, unmuting them as well.

commands.name: banAutodetectedRaid
commands.description: Ban all of the raiders in the raidview

commands.name: getBanReason
commands.description: Get the ban reason of someone logged who does not have a ban reason in the audit log.

commands.name: setBanReason
commands.description: Set the ban reason of someone logged who does not have a ban reason in the audit log.

commands.name: google
commands.description: google a thing

commands.name: addresource
commands.description: Add a channel resource to the current channel.

commands.name: listresources
commands.description: List current channel resources

commands.name: listresourcesids
commands.description: List current channel resources (w/ ids shown, for removeresource)

commands.name: removeresource
commands.description: Remove one or more of current channel resources

commands.name: resetresources
commands.description: Remove all of current channel resources.

commands.name: poll
commands.description: Create a poll with one question and 2 to 9 answers.
